result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J Morris

defendant.name: Morris, Christopher J
defendant.address: W6628 Eidsmoe Road, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Attorney French did not appear.  State requests that the case be dismissed.  Read in, in Monroe County.
From Attorney Molly French stating the hearing for Monday can come off and this case was disposed of with Monroe County case on 9-23-15.  Documentation is attached.
Certified copy of JOC from Monroe County case no. 15CF106.
Received request from Attorney French office to reschedule the Status Conf, originally set for 9/21/15. DA office and Attorney French office both agreed to 10/26/15 @ 3pm.  New notice sent out.

Pre-trial conference at 07-08-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 07-27-2015 03:45 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant appeared with counsel Molly French.  DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defense waived reading of the complaint; waived time limits for prelim; request pretrial and status dates.  Court reviewed waiver of time limits with defendant.  Finds he knowingly and intelligently waives the time limits.  Court set pretrial for 7-08 and status for 7-27-15 at 3:45.
Transmittal letter from attorney French along with MDD

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  Defendant will contact SPD.  Other options for attorneys explained to defendant by the court.  Bond amended.  AIA set for 6/15/15 at 9:30 am.
